signup.terms_modal_content:
Article 1 (Purpose)
The purpose of these Terms and Conditions is to prescribe the rights, obligations, and responsibilities of PUMWI (hereinafter referred to as the 'Company') and the User in connection with the use of the intermediary services provided by the Company.

Article 2 (Definitions)
1. 'Platform' refers to the virtual business place established by the Company for trading goods or services.
2. 'Artist' refers to a member who enters the platform to sell their creations.

Article 3 (Services)
The Company provides the following services:
1. Development and operation of a handmade/craft brokerage platform.
2. Information provision regarding artists and artworks.
3. Other businesses determined by the Company.

Article 4 (Copyright)
1. The copyright of posts (photos, descriptions, etc.) created by the Artist belongs to the Artist.
2. The Company may reproduce, display, and distribute posts within the scope necessary for smooth service provision.

Article 5 (Limitation of Liability)
As a mail-order intermediary, the Company is not a party to the transaction and is not responsible for the product information or transactions registered by the Artist, except in cases of intentional or gross negligence by the Company.

(These terms are standard for the PUMWI service launch.)
signup.marketing_modal_content:
PUMWI requests your consent to receive marketing information as follows:

1. Purpose of Collection and Use
- Notifications of new artist entries and exhibitions.
- News on limited edition releases and promotions.
- Newsletters featuring artist interviews and studio logs.

2. Items Collected
- Email address, Name.

3. Retention and Use Period
- Until membership withdrawal or consent withdrawal.

4. Right to Refuse
- You have the right to refuse this consent. However, you may not receive event and benefit notifications if you do so.

PUMWI promises to send only carefully selected news related to artistic values and avoids spam.

founders_letter.title: A Letter from Korea, with Respect for Your Craft
founders_letter.content:
Dear Artist,

I am the founder of PUMWI, writing to you from Korea. I created this platform because I could not stand seeing true craftsmanship being undervalued online.

I want your dedication to be recognized for its true worth.

Please consistently share your **'Craft Diary'** and exhibition news. When you detail your philosophy and values, this storytelling becomes the key to having your true worth recognized online.

Also, please utilize our **'Artisan Operation'** system. We built this automation system to handle complex administration, so you can focus solely on **'Creating Masterpieces'**.

We are here to support your art.
